**The Supreme Clarity Scripture on Essential Practices for Cultivating the Body**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Scripture on Essential Practices for Cultivating the Body*. Author unknown, likely composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties or the Sui-Tang period. Excerpts key cultivation methods from *The Numinous Book of Purple Texts* and other Supreme Clarity scriptures. One scroll.

**Source:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

### *The Supreme Clarity Scripture on Essential Practices for Cultivating the Body*

#### **Method One: The Purple Text of the Grand Tenuity’s Numinous Book for Restraining the Three Hun**
Daoists must first discipline the *hun* and *po*, eliminating corpse-demons. On the last day of the lunar month, the first day of the new moon, the *gengshen* day, and the *jiayin* day, one should enter seclusion in purity, bathe to cleanse the dust, and sit upright upon a mat. Those who remain awake gain greater benefit. With a brush of cinnabar, mark the lower corner of the left eye; with a brush of realgar, mark the lower part of the right nostril, allowing the pigment to penetrate slightly inward.

Upon completion, strike the teeth three times and recite the incantation:
*"The twin luminaries coil in flight, cinnabar and realgar scatter mist.
Qi seizes the empty and perverse; corpse-filth sinks into oblivion.
Harmonize the hun, refine the po; unite form with the great spirit.
Grant me undying life, eternal wholeness,
keen vision, and ever-flowing divine essence."*

Finish by striking the teeth three more times, swallowing saliva thrice, and pressing the second finger of the right hand to the lower corner of the left eye, then the second finger of the left hand to the lower part of the right nostril—seven times each. Press firmly without lifting the hands. This concludes the practice.

These two points are the gateways through which the seven *po* and wandering corpses roam, the bridges by which demonic spirits and malevolent forces traverse. Thus, they receive the essence of cinnabar and realgar, sealing the paths of corpse-demons and infusing the twin luminaries’ fragrance to extinguish the qi of licentious chaos. This is a supreme method of the Great Ultimate. By practicing it regularly, the *hun* and *po* will harmonize, corpse-filth will disperse and vanish, and one may attain longevity as a divine immortal with penetrating vision. After three years of practice, lustful thoughts will entirely fade.

These days are called the "Days of Strife Between Corpse and Demon." Men and women must not share the same mat. Be cautious.

Whenever studying the profound Dao or reciting sacred scriptures, after every ten or twenty words, lick the lips and swallow saliva three times. After every fifty or a hundred words, strike the teeth two or three times to summon spirits, harmonize the divine, and settle the blood and qi, causing the numinous essence to congeal and fill the body, delighting the Celestial Unity. This is what is meant by "the qi flows without effort, dim yet not dissipated."

Daoist methods forbid weeping or spitting, for these deplete the fluids and leak the essence, exhausting the throat and brain. Thus, perfected ones and Daoists constantly practice exhalation, inhalation, and swallowing to harmonize the six fluids.

Daoists should always visualize their own form, making it vividly appear before them. Imagine the face perpetually illuminated by the light of the sun and moon, bathing the entire body in radiance—the sun on the left, the moon on the right, nine inches from the face.

Upon completing the visualization, peck the teeth three times and recite:
*"Primordial womb, perfected one of the upper realm,
twin luminaries of the two mysteries,
on the right, embrace the seven po;
on the left, restrain the three hun.
Grant me divine clarity, that spirit and form may endure together."*

Finish by striking the teeth twenty-one times and swallowing saliva seven times. This is called the "Method of the Celestial Lord for Visualizing the Form, Restraining the Hun, and Disciplining the Po." It bestows keen intelligence, immortality, and eternal life. If unable to recite the incantation, visualization alone suffices.

All Supreme Clarity methods for striking the teeth and swallowing saliva follow specific procedures, with a proper sequence. They must not be practiced haphazardly, lest the true spirits become confused.

Striking the teeth commands the spirits; swallowing qi harmonizes the true. Inhaling and swallowing the six fluids to circulate and restrain the spirits requires the sounding of the ritual drum in proper order.

In all Supreme Clarity practices, when performing rites or reciting incantations, first peck the teeth, striking upper and lower together—never side to side. With each exhalation and inhalation, swallow the qi and fluids. This is called "summoning the spirits and harmonizing the true" for the sake of ascending as an immortal.

On the evening of the third and thirteenth days of the lunar month, the three *hun* become unsettled. The Radiant Spirit wanders, Fetal Light manifests its form, and Dark Essence stirs and calls. *Shuangling*, *Taiguang*, and *Youjing* are the names of the three *hun* spirits. On these evenings, they abandon the body and roam, swiftly departing their chambers. They may be detained or restrained by other spirits, seized by ghostly entities, or fail to return, causing the form to disperse. They may clash with external spirits, their two qi contending, agitating the "red child" and inducing stray thoughts, aimless comings and goings, sorrow, and melancholy.

Cultivators must restrain and retain them to prevent their escape. The method for restraint is as follows: Lie supine with the head elevated, extend the feet, and cross the hands over the heart. Close the eyes, hold the breath for three cycles, strike the teeth three times, and visualize a red qi the size of a chicken egg rising from within, emerging through the eyes. As it exits, the red qi expands, enveloping the body, flowing downward and upward to the neck, transforming into fire that engulfs the entire form, inside and out, like burning charcoal. When finished, one should feel a slight warmth in the body. Then strike the teeth three times and visualize calling the names of the three *hun*: *Shuangling*, *Taiguang*, *Youjing*—commanding them to halt at once.

Recite softly:
*"Palace of the Grand Tenuity, Primordial Yellow and First Green,
refine the three hun within, Fetal Light be at peace.
Jewel chamber of the divine treasure, born with me,
do not move recklessly. The Great Numinous One oversees.
If you wish to fly, ascend only to the Great Ultimate and Supreme Clarity.
If you hunger or thirst, drink only the Jade Essence of the Returning Spring."*

This concludes the practice.

#### **Method Two: The Purple Text of the Grand Tenuity’s Numinous Book for Restraining the Seven Po**
On the evenings of the new moon, full moon, and last day of the lunar month, the seven *po* wander and drift, roaming through filth and impurity. They may commune with blood offerings, consorting with ghosts and spirits, or enter into dead corpses. They may seduce the "red child" into licentiousness and assault the home, or report a person’s sins to the Three Officials and the River Earl. They may transform into *wangliang* spirits, causing people to be afflicted by malevolent forces, or lead ghosts into the body to summon evil and slay the essence.

All afflictions and ailments that befall the living arise from the sins of the *po*; delight in others’ deaths is the nature of the *po*; desire for others’ ruin is the malady of the *po*. The Daoist must restrain and discipline them, refine and transform them, suppress and halt them, subdue and overawe them.

The first *po* is named Corpse Hound; the second, Crouching Arrow; the third, Sparrow Yin; the fourth, Swallowing Thief; the fifth, Non-Poison; the sixth, Removing Filth; the seventh, Stinking Membrane. These are the yin names of the seven *po*, the turbid ghosts within the body.

The method of restraint and regulation: cross your hands over the nape of your neck, hold your breath seven times, and click your teeth seven times. Visualize a white *qi* at the tip of your nose, small as a bean, which gradually grows larger until it envelops your body in nine layers, descending to your feet and ascending to the crown of your head. Once complete, the white *qi* suddenly transforms into a Celestial Beast. Command two Azure Dragons to stand within your eyes, two White Tigers within your nostrils, all facing outward. A Vermilion Bird perches above your heart, facing your mouth. A Green Dragon lies beneath your left foot, a Numinous Serpent beneath your right. In your ears stand Jade Maidens clad in dark brocade, stationed at the ear gates, each holding a flame in hand.

After a long while, swallow your saliva seven times and click your teeth seven times. Then call the names of the seven *po* and softly intone:
*"Pristine *qi* revolves ninefold,
Restraining the *po*’s malevolence and ferocity.
Celestial Beast guards the gate,
Maidens wield the bolts.
Refine the *po* to harmony and gentleness,
That they may dwell in peace with me.
Do not stir recklessly,
But observe and examine the origin of forms.
If you hunger or thirst,
You may drink the Moon’s Yellow and the Sun’s Cinnabar."*

This concludes the practice. Thus, the seven *po* are inwardly sealed, bound to submission. If practiced constantly, the turbid *po* will dissolve below, returning to goodness and abiding in the body. Above, they harmonize with the Three Palaces and unite with the primordial to merge with the numinous.

#### **Method Three: The Venerable Perfected of the Great Simplicity’s Teaching for Beginners to Avert Nightmares**
If one frequently encounters nightmares, they may be of three kinds: first, *po*-demon harassment; second, trials of the heart; third, corpse-thieves. Here is the method to dispel and dissolve them.

Upon waking from a dream, pinch your philtrum with your left hand thirty-four times, click your teeth thirty-four times, and softly intone:
*"Great Cavern, truly mysterious,
Zhang refines the Three *Hun*.
Let the first *hun* swiftly guard the seven *po*,
The second *hun* swiftly guard the Muddy Pellet,
The third *hun* receive the heart’s command,
Swiftly summon the Three Lords of the Great Simplicity."*

*"The inauspicious dream just encountered
Was the seven *po*’s wandering corpse come to conspire,
The source of ten thousand evils.
Hasten to call Peach-Kang to protect life,
Report above to the Imperial Lord,
The Five Elders and Nine Perfected,
All guarding the gates of the body.
Yellow Gate Divine Master,
Purple Portal General,
Grasping halberds and holding bells,
They rout and destroy evil miasmas,
Turning misfortune to fortune,
Severing ties with life and death."*

This concludes the practice. If you lie down again, you will surely receive a favorable response. The malevolent *qi* that once formed the nightmare will be sealed beneath the Celestial Pass. After three years, only divine resonance will evoke dreams, and all dreams will reveal clear foresight of things to come. No longer will there be ominous portents or inauspicious visions.

If you encounter a propitious dream at night, a fortunate omen or pleasant vision that your heart deems auspicious, then upon waking, rub your eyes thirty-four times, click your teeth thirty-four times, and softly intone:
*"Supreme High Essence,
Three Emperors’ Cinnabar Numinous,
Crimson Palace luminous and clear,
Auspicious resonance declares its intent.
The Three Origins soften the *po*,
The Heavenly Thearch bestows the scripture.
All directions harmonize,
Flying immortals ascend to the Upper Clarity,
Ever with the Jade Perfected,
Together assembling in the Purple Court."*

This concludes the practice.

This is the profound secret method of the Great Cavern, transmitted to those who first wade into the stream of the Dao.

**Four Methods of Auspicious Dreams Received by the Perfected of Supreme Simplicity**
Whenever a scholar in training dreams of a woman dressed in purple silk, bearing a tray of food to offer, partake of it without fear or aversion. This food consists entirely of the true essences of the Eastern Sea or the wondrous herbs from the Five Peaks of Mount Song, and consuming it may extend one’s lifespan.

Whenever a Daoist lies down to rest during the day, first press the eyes with both hands four times, thirty-seven cycles, and click the teeth thirty-seven times before reclining.

Whenever a Daoist retires at dusk, press the nostrils with the left hand thirty-seven times, click the teeth thirty-seven times, and then recline.

**Five: The Yellow Simplicity Daoist’s Prayer for Peaceful Sleep**
When a Daoist is about to sleep, stroke the heart three times with the hand, close the eyes, and softly intone:
*"Supreme Numinous Nine Palaces,
Great One guards the chamber,
A hundred spirits attend their stations,
Hun and po harmonize as one,
Long life without death,
Sealing away all evil and misfortune."*
Then sleep.

**Six: Jade Clarity’s Prayer to Dispel Demons and Subdue Malevolent Spirits**
Whenever a Daoist travels alone and lodges in a place haunted by demonic essences or evil ghosts, click the left teeth thirty-six times, hold the breath, and softly intone:
*"Supreme Thearch of Yang Primordial,
Four Nether Gates of the Dark,
A thousand demons, ten thousand poisons,
Dare not face me!
Mighty beasts with layered jaws,
Rip open bellies, sever livers,
Divine lords and messengers,
Guard and patrol in rotation,
Yellow-robed master soldiers,
Slay and behead demonic spirits,
Decapitate a thousand demons,
Crush and cast down all evil,
Exterminate their kind, annihilate their lineage,
Render them utterly destroyed,
By the command of the Jade Emperor,
Purify and sweep the Three Origins."*
Then click the teeth thirty-six times again. This is called the *Supreme Thearch’s Inner Prayer to Wield the Spirits and Annihilate Myriad Demons*.

**Seven: The Yellow Simplicity Daoist’s Method for Encountering Inauspicious Objects During Purification**
When a Daoist enters a chamber for purification and encounters an inauspicious object, perform the Northern Emperor’s prayer to expel ghosts. First click the left teeth thirty-six times and intone:
*"Two Images reverse their course,
Banner of the Dark One,
Seven Numinous protect life,
Ascend to the Three Clarities,
Twin August Ones drive away,
Terrifying the legions of Luo,
Three hundred thousand soldiers,
Attend the divine encampment,
Mighty beasts a hundred yards long,
Spit forth might to seize essences,
Brandish swords to chase away evil,
Behead and cast down demonic spirits,
By the prayer of the Divine Lord,
A thousand demons annihilate their forms."*
Then click the teeth thirty-six times again.

**Eight: The Azure Waist Purple Writ’s Method for Refining and Praying Over the Dead**
When cultivating the Dao of Upper Clarity, if the practitioner’s parents, uncles, brothers, or other kin die in the world, and the practitioner has not yet severed their traces, thus encountering the corpse of one who has died among the living, on the third day take a jar of pure water and one tael of true cinnabar, cast them into the water, and stand facing south in the central courtyard before the water. Click the teeth nine times and intone:
*"Qi transforms into spirit,
Corpse transmutes into the mysterious,
Three transformations, five refinements,
Ascend into the Nine Heavens,
Through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens,
Cross over into a new body,
The body further transforms,
Attaining the Perfected."*
Afterward, if the deceased is male, visualize three Jade Lads; if female, visualize seven Jade Maidens. Fill the jar with water and pour it over the corpse, then wash one’s own hands and face with the water, rinsing the mouth toward the sky.

Then secretly intone:
*"Heavenly qi is now pure,
Human transformation is now born,
Attaining birth in the heavens above,
Nine transformations renew the form,
Five sufferings, Three Paths,
Sever the name of death,
Deliver the destitute souls,
Return to the Southern Court."*
Cease. Thus the deceased will undergo further transformation and be reborn in the heavens above, ascending to the Jade Clarity Palace after nine years. This method surpasses the Great Cavern’s method for delivering the seven ancestors. It is a secret of the Jade Emperor, not to be transmitted to the unworthy. Those who possess the *Golden Name Imperial Chart* in green characters on purple script—having seen this text—must not lightly employ it or recklessly disclose it to others. Otherwise, the seven generations of ancestors will be eternally confined to the ghostly bureaus, suffering the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas without release.

The *Four Extremities Bright Statutes* have existed for seven hundred years. Perfected Ones, heed this transmission.

**Nine: The Azure Waist Purple Writ’s Method for Encountering Another’s Corpse While Traveling the Dao**
Whenever a scholar of the highest learning traverses the paths of the world and suddenly encounters a corpse along the way, its defiling qi assailing the body, the practitioner should walk twenty-four steps, stop, face north, and click the teeth nine times. If the corpse is male, visualize three Jade Lads; if female, visualize seven Jade Maidens, coming to invite the practitioner to the Jade Valley, where they draw yellow mushroom and pure water to pour over the corpse. In a moment, visualize the corpse transforming and reviving as a living person, then secretly intone:
*"Withered, revive in glory,
Extinguished, revive in life,
Attaining birth in the heavens above,
Receiving the Supreme Numinous,
Through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens,
Reversing and renewing the embryo,
Defilements and burdens dissolve and vanish,
White corpse revives."*
Cease, then wipe the eyes fourteen times. Thus the defiling qi will disperse, and the dead will undergo further transformation, later becoming a spirit-person.

If the practitioner encounters this twenty-four times and performs this refining prayer, merit will be fulfilled, virtue augmented, and their name inscribed in Upper Clarity. After twenty-four years, they will be able to ride the spirit-chariot and soar through the Nine Mysteries.

**Ten: The Method for Assessing the Auspiciousness of Mountain Dwellings Based on Foreign Categories**
*Inner Inscription of the Nine Earths and Thirty-Six Sounds of the Abyssal Cavern:*
**First Rampart:** Earth of lustrous color—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*, each one.
**Second Rampart:** Earth of rigid color—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*, each one (same below).
**Third Rampart:** Earth of stone-fat luster—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*.
**Fourth Rampart:** Earth of moist luster—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*.
**Fifth Rampart:** Earth of golden millet luster—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*.
**Sixth Rampart:** Earth of adamantine iron color—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*.
**Seventh Rampart:** Earth of water-controlled luster—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*.
**Eighth Rampart:** Earth of great wind luster—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound*.

**Ninth Rampart:** Earth of cavernous abyss, colorless and adamantine—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound* of the qi of the cardinal directions.

When desiring to ascend a mountain for dwelling or to establish a residence, examine the auspiciousness or inauspiciousness of the land. On a *wu* or *ji* day, inscribe the thirty-six sounds of the nine earths in yellow script upon white paper, place it at the center of the intended dwelling, and cover it with an earthen jar. After three nights, uncover and observe: if the paper appears moist and yellow, it is greatly auspicious; if blue, there lies a corpse of the dead beneath; if white, it is inauspicious; if red, there will be fright and terror; if black, there is buried treasure; if purple, one will attain immortality. If no changes appear, the land is correct and may be dwelt upon securely for three years—beyond this, harm will surely follow.

**Method of Invocation for the Eight Mighty Wieldings of the Divine Staff (11):**
*"Primordial Supreme Perfection, Five Numinous Exalted Ones, Radiant Sovereign of Great Brilliance, Luminous Eight Gates, Five Elders Declare the Mandate—none in the hidden depths escapes their hearing. Above, they govern the Nine Heavens; at the center, they command Mount Feng; below, they rule the rivers and seas, the twelve water sources. The Eight Mighty Divine Incantations, the numinous staff of jade script, summon dragons to bear water, gather qi to amass clouds, bind demons and dispatch ghosts, sweep away hordes of malevolent spirits, shatter the myriad spirits, and annihilate all that is condemned without exception. Sun, moon, and five planets; the Northern Dipper’s seven luminaries; all heavens and all earths; all waters and all mountains; the jade perfected under their command; the great spirits of the netherworld; the Immortal Kings at their feasts; the Five Emperors with their staves and banners; the Heavenly Soldiers as vanguard; the Golden Tigers in pursuit; the fierce beasts of the celestial apes; the guardians arrayed at the four gates—what is called arrives instantly, what is summoned appears before one. The vermilion script blazes forth, wind and fire unceasing. Wherever there is verification and subjugation, the golden dragon swiftly transmits. Conclude by knocking the teeth nine times, raising the head to the sky and emitting three whistles, drawing in the celestial qi three times, and pointing the Eight Mighty Staff’s script toward the designated place. Hold the breath for nine breaths and cease."*

**Method for Wielding the Divine Staff (12):**
When a Daoist wishes to employ the method of the divine staff, they should knock their teeth thirty-six times and visualize the *Direct Talisman Officials* of the Five Emperors, each clad in the color of their respective direction, their five-colored radiance flowing and illuminating the staff. Each of the Five Emperors’ Jade Maidens stands in attendance, guarding the staff to left and right. Silently intone:
*"Mountain of the Great Yang, primordial essence of the Highest Beginning, opener of heaven and extender of earth, sweet bamboo conduit of the numinous. Direct Talisman Guardians, officials who command the divine soldiers, five-colored radiance flowing upon the staff, crimson robes and golden bells—assist the perfected ones, emerging from darkness into obscurity. Summon the heavens, and the heavens obey; subjugate the earth, and the earth yields. Point at ghosts, and ghosts perish; bind demons, and malevolence takes form. The numinous talisman and divine staff command might over the hundred directions. With me they are accomplished, with me they are born. After ten thousand kalpas, they shall replace my form, their shadows becoming the Five Liberations. My spirit ascends to the Upper Clarity, receiving the talisman and proclaiming the mandate—none dare fail to heed with reverence."*
Conclude by drawing in the qi of the five directions twenty times. Point the staff toward the heavens, and the celestial deities will render homage; point it toward the earth, and the earthly spirits will receive and welcome. Point the staff toward the northeast, and the myriad ghosts will be bound in form.

**Purple-Script Method for Rescuing the Sun During an Eclipse (13):**
Purple-script oral formula: On the day of the eclipse, expose oneself in the central courtyard. Face the sun with a bright mirror, wield a large blade, and knock the teeth thirty-six times while facing south. Raise the head and intone:
*"Luminous Child of the Sun, essence of the radiant yang, Illuminating Perfected One of the Net, Jade Spirit within the shadow—through the cycles you ride the qi, ascending and descending in solemn clarity. The dark sphere plots within, encroaching upon the sun’s court. The Heavenly Mirror wields the staff; the Emperor’s ministers command the soldiers. The Three and Five hold their proper positions; the yang light shines through. Heaven and earth alternate in devouring—what presumptuous phantom dares arise? Return each to its place; let no deficiency or excess occur. The Jade Emperor proclaims the mandate—none dare fail to halt in reverence."*
Then draw in the qi twenty-four times and cease. Thus, heaven and earth return to their positions, the Three and Five shine in unison, the Luminous Child is moved to joy, the sun’s radiance returns, and the mysterious influx of flowing light descends upon one’s form. One’s name is inscribed upon the purple tablets, recorded in the jade chapters of the Upper Clarity. Within nine years, one shall ride the green chariot, soaring through the void, ascending to the Upper Clarity.

**Purple-Script Method for Rescuing the Moon During an Eclipse (14):**
Purple-script oral formula: On the day of the lunar eclipse, at dusk, expose oneself in the central courtyard. Take a jar of pure water, wield a blade, and face the moon while knocking the teeth sixteen times. Raise the head and intone:
*"Heaven and earth separate and unite; the round qi waxes and wanes. Encroaching upon the moon’s chamber, it offends the yellow radiance. The Emperor’s ministers wield their staves; the Jade Dawn mends the flaw. The heavenly soldiers array themselves; the divine lords unleash their might. What presumptuous phantom dares cling to the shadow and exploit the faint? Swiftly return to your original place; let no transgression occur."*
Repeat this invocation three times while facing the moon. With the blade, stir the water in the jar three times to the right, then cease. Face the water and draw in the qi sixteen times. The lunar eclipse will then dissolve, the celestial scene will be solemn and clear, the Three and Five will shine in unison, and the myriad palaces will be at peace. The True Person and Lady of Luminous Radiance within the moon, moved to joy and delight, will turn their mysterious radiance toward you. They shall record your name before the Northern Emperor, strike your name from the ledger of the dead, and inscribe it in the jade chapters of the Azure Palace. Twelve Jade Maidens shall be granted to attend and guard your form. After nine years of such practice, you shall ride the flying rosy clouds to ascend to the Moon’s Court. This method is most wondrous—do not practice it in the world. Those who obtain it must treasure and conceal it; be cautious never to transmit it lightly.

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Dispelling Filth and Impurities (Fifteen)**
Whenever a Daoist encounters a corpse, blood, or any impure substance, they should take a *zhū* of cinnabar, scatter it into water, and use it to wash their eyes, rinse their mouth, and cleanse their hands and feet. Upon completion, they shall enter their chamber, assume a proper resting posture, cross their hands over their heart, and knock their teeth together twice seven times. Then, bowing in the four directions, they shall recite the prayer:

*"The Three Primes and the Supreme Dao,
The Great One guards my form.
The Lord of Life and the Divine Youth,
The Five Spirits bring yellow peace.
Blood-corpses scatter and vanish,
Ominous filth sinks and decays.
The Seven Fluids coil and infuse,
The Five Viscera bloom anew.
Grant that I, a divine immortal,
Enjoy enduring prosperity and purity."*

After the prayer, close both eyes and hold the breath for a long while; a slight warmth within the body shall serve as the sign. Then knock the teeth together seven times and swallow saliva thrice. This is the Inner Method of the Three Primes for Dispelling Impurities.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Combing Hair and Washing the Head (Sixteen)**
Whenever a Daoist combs their hair to arrange their topknot or washes their head with unbound hair, they shall first knock their teeth together seven times, then recite the prayer:

*"The Supreme Emperor scatters blossoms,
The Mysterious Yin, great spirit.
On this auspicious day,
I comb my hair and wash away dust.
Banish evil, dispel misfortune,
Attain long life as a divine immortal."*

After reciting, arrange the topknot. Upon completion, knock the teeth together seven times again. This is called the Supreme Emperor’s Blossom-Scattering Inner Method for Combing Hair. Practicing it ensures freedom from illness throughout the year, sharp hearing and vision, and no pain in the head or brain.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Bathing the Body and Washing Hands and Face (Seventeen)**
Whenever a Daoist bathes their body or washes their hands and face, they shall first stand before the water and knock their teeth together three times, then recite the prayer:

*"The Four Great open and brighten,
Heaven and Earth endure as constants.
Mysterious waters cleanse impurity,
Banishing inauspicious omens.
The Twin Stars guard the gate,
The Seven Spirits settle the chambers.
Cloudy essences refine and bathe,
Myriad qi harmonize in health.
Within and without, prosperity and purity,
Preserve this yellow robe."*

After the prayer, knock the teeth together three more times, then wash the hands and face. This is called the Seven Chambers Prayer Method for Bathing Away Filth and Dispelling Misfortune. Those who practice it regularly shall attain divine clarity, vigorous blood, and repel all malign qi.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Praying Before Fasting and Eating (Eighteen)**
Whenever a Daoist enters seclusion for fasting, before eating, they shall hold their chopsticks in their left hand, knock the plate three times, and recite the prayer:

*"The Two Mysteries and the Supreme Dao,
The Four Poles are pure and cool.
The Supreme One, Lord of Emperors,
The Hundred Spirits bring yellow peace.
Receive sustenance in the Three Palaces,
Irrigate the numinous spleen.
Offer up the Supreme Harmony,
Feast on the five fragrant flavors.
The soul-embryo receives life,
The Seven Fluids flow and settle.
The hundred passages open in harmony,
The Five Viscera bloom with light.
The Twin Stars merge their radiance,
Soaring to ascend the Upper Clarity."*

After eating, knock the plate three more times. This is called the Way of the Soul-Embryo Receiving Fragrance and the Hundred Spirits Feasting on Sustenance. Practicing it regularly ensures divine clarity, harmonious qi, peaceful hun and po, dispels evil and trials, and perpetually preserves prosperity. The prayer is recited before eating.

When a Daoist faces a sumptuous feast, they shall compose their mind and focus on unity, visualizing the food before consuming it. After eating, they shall silently recite the prayer:

*"The hundred grains enter the stomach,
Uniting with the spirit in qi.
They replenish blood and fluids,
Causing corpse-demons to fall away.
Ascend in flight to the Golden Towers,
Abide long between Heaven and Earth.
Command the Six Dings,
Divine youths attend and guard."*

Those who practice this consistently shall cause malign qi to retreat and true qi to advance. The prayer is recited after eating.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Daoists’ Self-Massage of the Head and Face (Nineteen)**
To seek the Dao, one must first ensure clear eyes and sharp ears. The ears and eyes are the ladder for seeking the true and the gate for gathering the numinous; gain and loss are determined in an instant, and life and death are discerned by them. The great teachings are here revealed for practice:

Press the small hollows behind both eyebrows twenty-seven times. Then, with the palms and fingers, massage the area beneath the eyes and above the cheekbones. They bare their throats to the heavens; fierce horses gallop high. Poisonous dragons brandish their claws; golden heads devour horizontally. Mighty soldiers number in the tens of thousands, receiving talismans to examine immortals. The Six Heavens are unrestrained, joining evil to form hordes. Demons drum and surge; defiled qi swirls in profusion. Empty cavern songs and chaotic sounds obstruct the clouds. Petty ghosts trade punishments, targeting the gate of human life. The divine kings proclaim: there is no seclusion they do not hear. Above, they seize the Six Qi; below, they inspect the river sources. The Five Marchmounts and Four Watercourses swiftly distinguish good from evil. By the tens of thousands, by the thousands, they come before me. The Five Thearchs examine and record: those with merit are pardoned. A thousand demons and true spirits, their forms bound by the Thearch-Lord—dare they not obey the command? Those executed shall know no reprieve. Their livers shall be carved, their bellies ripped open, their heads severed, their roots extinguished. In the northern cauldron, they shall be steeped in boiling water; in the southern mound, they shall be burned by fire. The Golden Perfected records their qi; the Flowing Bell captures their souls. No trace of demonic corruption shall remain; their forms and origins shall be utterly exhausted. Bearing the Heavenly Scriptures on their bodies, their Dao and conduct follow the Orthodox Text. They cleanse and purify the Nine Qi, clarifying the Three Origins. The Mysterious Void uplifts the True, uniting above with the Natural. Let none dare harass or test me; any disturbance shall be reported above."*

When finished, draw in qi twelve times and cease.

This is the **Incantation of Wisdom to Dispel Demons**.

Whenever a scholar of the Dao travels through famous mountains, lodging alone amidst a hundred ghosts, trembling with fear, or when illness clings like an infant, and a host of ghosts guards the door—reciting this incantation once is like ice melting in a boiling cauldron or metal dissolving in scorching flames. The hun-soul and spirit become serene and upright; qi is calmed, the body strengthened. Even if one’s fate were not destined to end thus, in the end, death itself would be unattainable.

**The Essential Scripture on Cultivating the Body from the Supreme Clarity Tradition, Concluded**

chunks.original_text: 上清修身要事经 经名：上清修身要事经。 撰人不详，约出於南北朝或隋唐。 摘录《灵书紫文》等上清经修行要诀。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 上清修身要事经 太微灵书紫文拘三魂之法一 道士当先检制魂魄，消灭尸鬼。 常以月晦、朔之日，及庚申、甲寅之日，当清斋入室，沐浴尘埃，正席而坐，得不眠者益佳，当以真朱笔点左目眦下，以雄黄笔点右鼻孔下，令小半入里。 点毕，叩齿三通，祝曰： 二景飞缠，朱黄散烟，气摄虚邪，尸秽沈泯，和魂炼魄，合形大神，令我不死，万寿永全，聪明彻视、长享利津。 毕，又叩齿三通，咽液三过，并以右手第二指捏左目眦下，又以左手第二指捏右鼻孔下各七过，当阴按之勿举手，於是都毕。 按此二处是七魄游尸之门户，妖精贼邪之津梁矣，故受朱黄之精，塞尸鬼之路，致二景之熏，灭淫乱之气。 此太极上法，常能行之，则魂魄安和，尸秽散绝，长生神仙，通灵彻视，行之三年，色念都泯也。 此日名曰尸鬼竞争之日也，男女不得同席而坐，慎之。 凡研味至道，及诵读神经，十言二十言辄当三过舐唇咽液，百言五十言辄两三过叩齿，以招神会灵，安和血气，使灵津凝满，帝一欣宅，所谓冲气不劳，昏而不泄。 凡道士之法，不可泣泪及唾泄，此皆为损液漏津，使喉脑大竭，是以真人道士常以吐纳咽味，以和六液。 凡道士常当存思识己之形容，极使仿髴对在我前，使面上恒有日月之光，洞照一形，使日在左，月在右，去面前令九寸。 存毕乃啄齿三通，祝曰： 元胎上真，双景二玄，右抱七魄，左拘三魂，令我神明，与形常存。 毕，又叩齿三七过，咽液七过，此名为帝君存形拘魂制魄之道，使人聪明，神仙长生不死，若不得祝者，亦可单存之耳。 凡上清叩齿咽液之法，皆各有方，先后有次，不得乱杂，使真灵混错也。 夫叩齿以命神，咽气以和真，纳和咽六液以运入制神，须鸣法鼓而行列矣。 凡存修上法，礼祝之时，皆先啄齿，上下相叩，勿左右也。 一呼一吸令得咽诸气液耳，此名为呼神和真，以求升仙者也。 月三日、月十三日夕，是此时也，三魂不定，爽灵浮游，胎光放形，幽精扰唤，其爽灵、胎光、幽精三君，是三魂之神名也，其夕皆弃身游遨，飙逝本室，或为他魂外鬼所见留制，或为鬼物所得收录，或不得还反，离形放质，或犯於外魂，二气共战，皆躁竞赤子，使为他念，去来无形，心悲意闷也。 学生者皆当拘而留之，使无游逸矣。 拘留之法，当安眠向上，下枕申足，交手心上，冥目闭气三息，叩齿三通，存心有赤气如鸡子从内仰上，出於目中，从目中出外，赤气转大覆身，下流身体，上至头项，变而成火，因以烧身，使匝一身，令内外洞彻，有如燃炭之状，都毕，其时当觉体中小热，乃大叩齿三通毕，存呼三魂名：爽灵、胎光、幽精，三魂急住。 因微祝曰： 太微玄宫，中黄始青，内炼三魂，胎光安宁，神宝玉室，与我俱生，不得妄动，监者太灵，若欲飞行，唯得诣太极上清，若欲饥渴，唯得饮回泉玉精。 都毕也。 太微灵书紫文制七魄之法二 月朔、月望、月晦夕，是此时也，七魄流荡，游走秽浊，或交通血食，鬼神往来，或与死尸相共关入，或淫惑赤子聚奸伐宅，或言人之罪，诣三官河伯，或变为魍魉，使人厌魅，或将鬼入身，呼邪杀质。

**The Supreme Clarity Scripture on Essential Practices for Cultivating the Body**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Scripture on Essential Practices for Cultivating the Body*. Author unknown, likely composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties or the Sui-Tang period. Excerpts key cultivation methods from *The Numinous Book of Purple Texts* and other Supreme Clarity scriptures. One scroll.

**Source:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

### *The Supreme Clarity Scripture on Essential Practices for Cultivating the Body*

#### **Method One: The Purple Text of the Grand Tenuity’s Numinous Book for Restraining the Three Hun**
Daoists must first discipline the *hun* and *po*, eliminating corpse-demons. On the last day of the lunar month, the first day of the new moon, the *gengshen* day, and the *jiayin* day, one should enter seclusion in purity, bathe to cleanse the dust, and sit upright upon a mat. Those who remain awake gain greater benefit. With a brush of cinnabar, mark the lower corner of the left eye; with a brush of realgar, mark the lower part of the right nostril, allowing the pigment to penetrate slightly inward.

Upon completion, strike the teeth three times and recite the incantation:
*"The twin luminaries coil in flight, cinnabar and realgar scatter mist.
Qi seizes the empty and perverse; corpse-filth sinks into oblivion.
Harmonize the hun, refine the po; unite form with the great spirit.
Grant me undying life, eternal wholeness,
keen vision, and ever-flowing divine essence."*

Finish by striking the teeth three more times, swallowing saliva thrice, and pressing the second finger of the right hand to the lower corner of the left eye, then the second finger of the left hand to the lower part of the right nostril—seven times each. Press firmly without lifting the hands. This concludes the practice.

These two points are the gateways through which the seven *po* and wandering corpses roam, the bridges by which demonic spirits and malevolent forces traverse. Thus, they receive the essence of cinnabar and realgar, sealing the paths of corpse-demons and infusing the twin luminaries’ fragrance to extinguish the qi of licentious chaos. This is a supreme method of the Great Ultimate. By practicing it regularly, the *hun* and *po* will harmonize, corpse-filth will disperse and vanish, and one may attain longevity as a divine immortal with penetrating vision. After three years of practice, lustful thoughts will entirely fade.

These days are called the "Days of Strife Between Corpse and Demon." Men and women must not share the same mat. Be cautious.

Whenever studying the profound Dao or reciting sacred scriptures, after every ten or twenty words, lick the lips and swallow saliva three times. After every fifty or a hundred words, strike the teeth two or three times to summon spirits, harmonize the divine, and settle the blood and qi, causing the numinous essence to congeal and fill the body, delighting the Celestial Unity. This is what is meant by "the qi flows without effort, dim yet not dissipated."

Daoist methods forbid weeping or spitting, for these deplete the fluids and leak the essence, exhausting the throat and brain. Thus, perfected ones and Daoists constantly practice exhalation, inhalation, and swallowing to harmonize the six fluids.

Daoists should always visualize their own form, making it vividly appear before them. Imagine the face perpetually illuminated by the light of the sun and moon, bathing the entire body in radiance—the sun on the left, the moon on the right, nine inches from the face.

Upon completing the visualization, peck the teeth three times and recite:
*"Primordial womb, perfected one of the upper realm,
twin luminaries of the two mysteries,
on the right, embrace the seven po;
on the left, restrain the three hun.
Grant me divine clarity, that spirit and form may endure together."*

Finish by striking the teeth twenty-one times and swallowing saliva seven times. This is called the "Method of the Celestial Lord for Visualizing the Form, Restraining the Hun, and Disciplining the Po." It bestows keen intelligence, immortality, and eternal life. If unable to recite the incantation, visualization alone suffices.

All Supreme Clarity methods for striking the teeth and swallowing saliva follow specific procedures, with a proper sequence. They must not be practiced haphazardly, lest the true spirits become confused.

Striking the teeth commands the spirits; swallowing qi harmonizes the true. Inhaling and swallowing the six fluids to circulate and restrain the spirits requires the sounding of the ritual drum in proper order.

In all Supreme Clarity practices, when performing rites or reciting incantations, first peck the teeth, striking upper and lower together—never side to side. With each exhalation and inhalation, swallow the qi and fluids. This is called "summoning the spirits and harmonizing the true" for the sake of ascending as an immortal.

On the evening of the third and thirteenth days of the lunar month, the three *hun* become unsettled. The Radiant Spirit wanders, Fetal Light manifests its form, and Dark Essence stirs and calls. *Shuangling*, *Taiguang*, and *Youjing* are the names of the three *hun* spirits. On these evenings, they abandon the body and roam, swiftly departing their chambers. They may be detained or restrained by other spirits, seized by ghostly entities, or fail to return, causing the form to disperse. They may clash with external spirits, their two qi contending, agitating the "red child" and inducing stray thoughts, aimless comings and goings, sorrow, and melancholy.

Cultivators must restrain and retain them to prevent their escape. The method for restraint is as follows: Lie supine with the head elevated, extend the feet, and cross the hands over the heart. Close the eyes, hold the breath for three cycles, strike the teeth three times, and visualize a red qi the size of a chicken egg rising from within, emerging through the eyes. As it exits, the red qi expands, enveloping the body, flowing downward and upward to the neck, transforming into fire that engulfs the entire form, inside and out, like burning charcoal. When finished, one should feel a slight warmth in the body. Then strike the teeth three times and visualize calling the names of the three *hun*: *Shuangling*, *Taiguang*, *Youjing*—commanding them to halt at once.

Recite softly:
*"Palace of the Grand Tenuity, Primordial Yellow and First Green,
refine the three hun within, Fetal Light be at peace.
Jewel chamber of the divine treasure, born with me,
do not move recklessly. The Great Numinous One oversees.
If you wish to fly, ascend only to the Great Ultimate and Supreme Clarity.
If you hunger or thirst, drink only the Jade Essence of the Returning Spring."*

This concludes the practice.

#### **Method Two: The Purple Text of the Grand Tenuity’s Numinous Book for Restraining the Seven Po**
On the evenings of the new moon, full moon, and last day of the lunar month, the seven *po* wander and drift, roaming through filth and impurity. They may commune with blood offerings, consorting with ghosts and spirits, or enter into dead corpses. They may seduce the "red child" into licentiousness and assault the home, or report a person’s sins to the Three Officials and the River Earl. They may transform into *wangliang* spirits, causing people to be afflicted by malevolent forces, or lead ghosts into the body to summon evil and slay the essence.

All afflictions and ailments that befall the living arise from the sins of the *po*; delight in others’ deaths is the nature of the *po*; desire for others’ ruin is the malady of the *po*. The Daoist must restrain and discipline them, refine and transform them, suppress and halt them, subdue and overawe them.

The first *po* is named Corpse Hound; the second, Crouching Arrow; the third, Sparrow Yin; the fourth, Swallowing Thief; the fifth, Non-Poison; the sixth, Removing Filth; the seventh, Stinking Membrane. These are the yin names of the seven *po*, the turbid ghosts within the body.

The method of restraint and regulation: cross your hands over the nape of your neck, hold your breath seven times, and click your teeth seven times. Visualize a white *qi* at the tip of your nose, small as a bean, which gradually grows larger until it envelops your body in nine layers, descending to your feet and ascending to the crown of your head. Once complete, the white *qi* suddenly transforms into a Celestial Beast. Command two Azure Dragons to stand within your eyes, two White Tigers within your nostrils, all facing outward. A Vermilion Bird perches above your heart, facing your mouth. A Green Dragon lies beneath your left foot, a Numinous Serpent beneath your right. In your ears stand Jade Maidens clad in dark brocade, stationed at the ear gates, each holding a flame in hand.

After a long while, swallow your saliva seven times and click your teeth seven times. Then call the names of the seven *po* and softly intone:
*"Pristine *qi* revolves ninefold,
Restraining the *po*’s malevolence and ferocity.
Celestial Beast guards the gate,
Maidens wield the bolts.
Refine the *po* to harmony and gentleness,
That they may dwell in peace with me.
Do not stir recklessly,
But observe and examine the origin of forms.
If you hunger or thirst,
You may drink the Moon’s Yellow and the Sun’s Cinnabar."*

This concludes the practice. Thus, the seven *po* are inwardly sealed, bound to submission. If practiced constantly, the turbid *po* will dissolve below, returning to goodness and abiding in the body. Above, they harmonize with the Three Palaces and unite with the primordial to merge with the numinous.

#### **Method Three: The Venerable Perfected of the Great Simplicity’s Teaching for Beginners to Avert Nightmares**
If one frequently encounters nightmares, they may be of three kinds: first, *po*-demon harassment; second, trials of the heart; third, corpse-thieves. Here is the method to dispel and dissolve them.

Upon waking from a dream, pinch your philtrum with your left hand thirty-four times, click your teeth thirty-four times, and softly intone:
*"Great Cavern, truly mysterious,
Zhang refines the Three *Hun*.
Let the first *hun* swiftly guard the seven *po*,
The second *hun* swiftly guard the Muddy Pellet,
The third *hun* receive the heart’s command,
Swiftly summon the Three Lords of the Great Simplicity."*

*"The inauspicious dream just encountered
Was the seven *po*’s wandering corpse come to conspire,
The source of ten thousand evils.
Hasten to call Peach-Kang to protect life,
Report above to the Imperial Lord,
The Five Elders and Nine Perfected,
All guarding the gates of the body.
Yellow Gate Divine Master,
Purple Portal General,
Grasping halberds and holding bells,
They rout and destroy evil miasmas,
Turning misfortune to fortune,
Severing ties with life and death."*

This concludes the practice. If you lie down again, you will surely receive a favorable response. The malevolent *qi* that once formed the nightmare will be sealed beneath the Celestial Pass. After three years, only divine resonance will evoke dreams, and all dreams will reveal clear foresight of things to come. No longer will there be ominous portents or inauspicious visions.

If you encounter a propitious dream at night, a fortunate omen or pleasant vision that your heart deems auspicious, then upon waking, rub your eyes thirty-four times, click your teeth thirty-four times, and softly intone:
*"Supreme High Essence,
Three Emperors’ Cinnabar Numinous,
Crimson Palace luminous and clear,
Auspicious resonance declares its intent.
The Three Origins soften the *po*,
The Heavenly Thearch bestows the scripture.
All directions harmonize,
Flying immortals ascend to the Upper Clarity,
Ever with the Jade Perfected,
Together assembling in the Purple Court."*

This concludes the practice.

chunks.original_text: 此大洞秘法，以传於始涉津流者矣。 太素真人得吉梦法四 凡学士梦想有妇女人，衣紫罗衣，持案食来受，而食之勿畏恶之也，此食尽是东海真彩之属，或是嵩高五岳中真草甚妙之药，食之可致寿延也。 凡道士白日眠卧，先以两手按目四訾三七过，叩齿三七通，乃卧也。 凡道士暮卧，当以左手按鼻两孔三七过，叩齿三七通，乃卧也。 太上黄素道士安眠祝法五 道士临眠，手抚心三过，闭目祝曰： 太灵九宫，太一守房，百神参位，魂魄和同，长生不死，塞灭邪凶。 毕而寝。 玉清消魔制祝鬼魅法六 凡道士行来独宿有魔精恶鬼之地，当叩左齿三十六通，闭气微祝曰： 太帝阳元，四罗幽关，千祆万毒，敢当吾前，巨兽重吻，刳腹屠肝，神公使者，守卫营番，黄衣师兵，斩伐祆魂，馘灭千魔，摧落凶奸，绝种灭类，取令枭残，玉帝上命，清荡三元。 毕，又叩齿三十六通，名为太帝挥神内祝塞灭万魔之法。 太上黄素斋见不祥之物法七 道士斋入室，有不祥之物者，当行北帝祝鬼方，先叩左齿三十六通，祝曰： 二象回倾，玄一之旌，七灵护命，上诣三清，双皇驱除，吓伯罗兵，三十万人，侍卫神营，巨兽百丈。 吐威摄精，挥剑逐邪，馘落魔灵，神伯所祝，千祆灭形。 毕，又叩齿三十六通。 青腰紫书炼祝死尸法八 凡修上清之道，兆身父母伯叔兄弟於世上死亡，兆身未得绝迹，故在人中身履死殗者，三日当取清水一瓫，真朱一两，投於水中，兆於中庭南向临水上，叩齿九通，祝曰： 气化成神，尸变入玄，三化五炼，升入九天，九天之劫，更度甲身，甲身更化，得为真人。 毕，男死思玉童三人，女死思玉女七人，盛瓫水以灌死人之尸，毕，取水自洗手面，仰天漱毕。 又阴祝曰： 天气已清，人化已生，得生上天，九变更形，五苦三涂，断落死名，超度穷魂，还反南庭。 止，如此亡人即更受化，生於九天之上，九年得升玉清之宫。 其法妙於大洞度七祖之法，玉帝所秘，不传非真，有金名帝图绿字紫文，得见此文，勿轻施用，妄告於人，七祖父母长闭鬼官，三涂五苦，万劫不原。 四极明科七百有年，真人听传。 青腰紫书行道见他死尸法九 凡上学之士，游更世路，忽於道次遇见死尸，秽气干身，兆当行二十四步止，北向叩齿九通，男尸思玉童三人，女尸思玉女七人，来请兆玉谷之中黄芝素水，以灌彼死尸之上，须臾存死尸化生成人，便阴祝曰： 已枯复荣，已灭复生，得生上天，更禀太灵，九天之劫，反覆胎婴，秽累荡灭，白尸反生。 毕，以手拭目二七过止。 如此秽气即解，死人即更受化，后为灵人。 兆遇二十四过，行此炼祝，功满德加，名标上清，二十四年，克乘灵轮，飞行九玄也。 外国放品占居山宅吉凶法十 洞渊九地三十六音内铭： 第一垒，色润地正音、行音、游音、梵音各一。 第二垒，刚色地正音、行音、游音、梵音亦各一，下同。 第三垒音，石脂色泽地正音、行音、游音、梵音。 第四垒音，润泽色地正音、行音、游音、梵音。 第五垒音，金粟泽色地正音、行音、游音、梵音。 第六垒音，金刚铁色地正音、行音、游音，梵音。 第七垒音，水制泽色地正音、行音、游音、梵音。 第八垒音，大风泽色地正音、行音、游音、梵音。

This is the profound secret method of the Great Cavern, transmitted to those who first wade into the stream of the Dao.

**Four Methods of Auspicious Dreams Received by the Perfected of Supreme Simplicity**
Whenever a scholar in training dreams of a woman dressed in purple silk, bearing a tray of food to offer, partake of it without fear or aversion. This food consists entirely of the true essences of the Eastern Sea or the wondrous herbs from the Five Peaks of Mount Song, and consuming it may extend one’s lifespan.

Whenever a Daoist lies down to rest during the day, first press the eyes with both hands four times, thirty-seven cycles, and click the teeth thirty-seven times before reclining.

Whenever a Daoist retires at dusk, press the nostrils with the left hand thirty-seven times, click the teeth thirty-seven times, and then recline.

**Five: The Yellow Simplicity Daoist’s Prayer for Peaceful Sleep**
When a Daoist is about to sleep, stroke the heart three times with the hand, close the eyes, and softly intone:
*"Supreme Numinous Nine Palaces,
Great One guards the chamber,
A hundred spirits attend their stations,
Hun and po harmonize as one,
Long life without death,
Sealing away all evil and misfortune."*
Then sleep.

**Six: Jade Clarity’s Prayer to Dispel Demons and Subdue Malevolent Spirits**
Whenever a Daoist travels alone and lodges in a place haunted by demonic essences or evil ghosts, click the left teeth thirty-six times, hold the breath, and softly intone:
*"Supreme Thearch of Yang Primordial,
Four Nether Gates of the Dark,
A thousand demons, ten thousand poisons,
Dare not face me!
Mighty beasts with layered jaws,
Rip open bellies, sever livers,
Divine lords and messengers,
Guard and patrol in rotation,
Yellow-robed master soldiers,
Slay and behead demonic spirits,
Decapitate a thousand demons,
Crush and cast down all evil,
Exterminate their kind, annihilate their lineage,
Render them utterly destroyed,
By the command of the Jade Emperor,
Purify and sweep the Three Origins."*
Then click the teeth thirty-six times again. This is called the *Supreme Thearch’s Inner Prayer to Wield the Spirits and Annihilate Myriad Demons*.

**Seven: The Yellow Simplicity Daoist’s Method for Encountering Inauspicious Objects During Purification**
When a Daoist enters a chamber for purification and encounters an inauspicious object, perform the Northern Emperor’s prayer to expel ghosts. First click the left teeth thirty-six times and intone:
*"Two Images reverse their course,
Banner of the Dark One,
Seven Numinous protect life,
Ascend to the Three Clarities,
Twin August Ones drive away,
Terrifying the legions of Luo,
Three hundred thousand soldiers,
Attend the divine encampment,
Mighty beasts a hundred yards long,
Spit forth might to seize essences,
Brandish swords to chase away evil,
Behead and cast down demonic spirits,
By the prayer of the Divine Lord,
A thousand demons annihilate their forms."*
Then click the teeth thirty-six times again.

**Eight: The Azure Waist Purple Writ’s Method for Refining and Praying Over the Dead**
When cultivating the Dao of Upper Clarity, if the practitioner’s parents, uncles, brothers, or other kin die in the world, and the practitioner has not yet severed their traces, thus encountering the corpse of one who has died among the living, on the third day take a jar of pure water and one tael of true cinnabar, cast them into the water, and stand facing south in the central courtyard before the water. Click the teeth nine times and intone:
*"Qi transforms into spirit,
Corpse transmutes into the mysterious,
Three transformations, five refinements,
Ascend into the Nine Heavens,
Through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens,
Cross over into a new body,
The body further transforms,
Attaining the Perfected."*
Afterward, if the deceased is male, visualize three Jade Lads; if female, visualize seven Jade Maidens. Fill the jar with water and pour it over the corpse, then wash one’s own hands and face with the water, rinsing the mouth toward the sky.

Then secretly intone:
*"Heavenly qi is now pure,
Human transformation is now born,
Attaining birth in the heavens above,
Nine transformations renew the form,
Five sufferings, Three Paths,
Sever the name of death,
Deliver the destitute souls,
Return to the Southern Court."*
Cease. Thus the deceased will undergo further transformation and be reborn in the heavens above, ascending to the Jade Clarity Palace after nine years. This method surpasses the Great Cavern’s method for delivering the seven ancestors. It is a secret of the Jade Emperor, not to be transmitted to the unworthy. Those who possess the *Golden Name Imperial Chart* in green characters on purple script—having seen this text—must not lightly employ it or recklessly disclose it to others. Otherwise, the seven generations of ancestors will be eternally confined to the ghostly bureaus, suffering the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas without release.

The *Four Extremities Bright Statutes* have existed for seven hundred years. Perfected Ones, heed this transmission.

**Nine: The Azure Waist Purple Writ’s Method for Encountering Another’s Corpse While Traveling the Dao**
Whenever a scholar of the highest learning traverses the paths of the world and suddenly encounters a corpse along the way, its defiling qi assailing the body, the practitioner should walk twenty-four steps, stop, face north, and click the teeth nine times. If the corpse is male, visualize three Jade Lads; if female, visualize seven Jade Maidens, coming to invite the practitioner to the Jade Valley, where they draw yellow mushroom and pure water to pour over the corpse. In a moment, visualize the corpse transforming and reviving as a living person, then secretly intone:
*"Withered, revive in glory,
Extinguished, revive in life,
Attaining birth in the heavens above,
Receiving the Supreme Numinous,
Through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens,
Reversing and renewing the embryo,
Defilements and burdens dissolve and vanish,
White corpse revives."*
Cease, then wipe the eyes fourteen times. Thus the defiling qi will disperse, and the dead will undergo further transformation, later becoming a spirit-person.

If the practitioner encounters this twenty-four times and performs this refining prayer, merit will be fulfilled, virtue augmented, and their name inscribed in Upper Clarity. After twenty-four years, they will be able to ride the spirit-chariot and soar through the Nine Mysteries.

**Ten: The Method for Assessing the Auspiciousness of Mountain Dwellings Based on Foreign Categories**

chunks.original_text: 第九垒音，洞渊无色刚维地气正音、行音、游音、梵音。 欲登山住止及安居宅，审地吉凶，当以戊己之日，黄书九地三十六音文白纸上，置所住中央，以瓫覆之，三宿开看。 若有黄色润纸，大吉； 若有青色，则下有死灵之尸； 若有白色者，凶； 若有赤色者，惊恐； 若有黑色者，则有财宝； 若有紫色者，得神仙。 都不异则正，可三年安，过此必折伤。 太上灵宝八威施用神策祝法十－ 元始太真，五灵高尊，太帝皓映，洞朗八门，五老告命，无幽不闻，上御九天，中制酆山，下领河海，十二水源，八威神咒，灵策玉文，召龙负水，收气聚云，束魔送鬼，扫荡祆群，万精摧落，所诛无蠲。 日月五星，北斗七元，诸天诸地，诸水诸山，玉真所部，冥灵大神，仙王游宴，五帝杖旛，天丁前驱，金虎后奔，玃天猛兽，罗备四门，所呼立到，所召立前，赤书焕落，风火无间，有所摄验，金龙驿传。 毕，叩齿九通，仰天三啸，引天气三咽，八威策文指所告之地，闭气九息而止。 太上灵宝八威施用神杖法十二 道士欲施用神杖法，当叩齿三十六通，思五帝直符吏各一人，衣随方色，有五色之光，流焕杖上，五帝玉女各一人，合侍卫杖左右。 微祝曰： 太阳之山，元始上精，开天张地，甘竹通灵，直符守吏，部御神兵，五色流焕，朱衣金铃，辅翼上真，出幽入冥，招天天恭，摄地地迎，指鬼鬼灭，祆魔束形，灵符神杖，威制百方，与我俱成，与我俱生，万劫之后，以代我形，影为五解，神升上清，承符告命，靡不敬听。 毕，引五方气二十咽止，以杖指天，天神设礼，指地地祇司迎，以杖指东北，万鬼束形。 青腰紫书救助日蚀法十三 紫书诀言：是日当露出中庭，以明镜向日，兆身操大刀一口，南向叩齿三十六通，仰祝曰：日晖童子，阳光赤精，耀罗真人，影中玉灵，历运乘气，上下肃清，阴员内谋，上侵日庭。 天鉴操杖，帝臣辅兵，三五正位，阳光洞明。 天地代食，何假敢生，各反其位，无使亏盈，玉帝告命，靡不敬停。 便引气二十四息止，如此则天地复位，三五齐光，童子感悦，日晖回灵，流光玄注，陶降兆身，列名紫简，记篇玉清，九年之内，得乘绿軿，乘空驾虚，飞行上清也。 青腰紫书救助月蚀法十四 紫书诀言：月蚀之日，是其夕当出中庭，取清水一瓫，兆身操刀一口，临水向月叩齿十六通，仰祝曰： 天地离合，圆气乘亏，侵蚀月庐，上干黄辉。 帝臣操杖，玉晨补非，天兵罗成，神公放威。 有何假生，附景乘微，速反初位，无使有违。 三过向月祝如此，以刀右还瓮水三过止，临水引气十六息毕，月蚀即解，天景肃清，三五齐耀，万宫安宁也。 月中真人夫人灵光，感悦意欢，回灵玄映，降子之情，即记北帝，落子死名，注上青宫玉篇，给子玉女十二人，侍卫兆身。 九年如此，得乘飞霞，上造月庭。 其道至妙，不行於世，得者宝秘，慎勿轻传。

**Ninth Rampart:** Earth of cavernous abyss, colorless and adamantine—*Correct Sound, Moving Sound, Wandering Sound, Brahma Sound* of the qi of the cardinal directions.

When desiring to ascend a mountain for dwelling or to establish a residence, examine the auspiciousness or inauspiciousness of the land. On a *wu* or *ji* day, inscribe the thirty-six sounds of the nine earths in yellow script upon white paper, place it at the center of the intended dwelling, and cover it with an earthen jar. After three nights, uncover and observe: if the paper appears moist and yellow, it is greatly auspicious; if blue, there lies a corpse of the dead beneath; if white, it is inauspicious; if red, there will be fright and terror; if black, there is buried treasure; if purple, one will attain immortality. If no changes appear, the land is correct and may be dwelt upon securely for three years—beyond this, harm will surely follow.

**Method of Invocation for the Eight Mighty Wieldings of the Divine Staff (11):**
*"Primordial Supreme Perfection, Five Numinous Exalted Ones, Radiant Sovereign of Great Brilliance, Luminous Eight Gates, Five Elders Declare the Mandate—none in the hidden depths escapes their hearing. Above, they govern the Nine Heavens; at the center, they command Mount Feng; below, they rule the rivers and seas, the twelve water sources. The Eight Mighty Divine Incantations, the numinous staff of jade script, summon dragons to bear water, gather qi to amass clouds, bind demons and dispatch ghosts, sweep away hordes of malevolent spirits, shatter the myriad spirits, and annihilate all that is condemned without exception. Sun, moon, and five planets; the Northern Dipper’s seven luminaries; all heavens and all earths; all waters and all mountains; the jade perfected under their command; the great spirits of the netherworld; the Immortal Kings at their feasts; the Five Emperors with their staves and banners; the Heavenly Soldiers as vanguard; the Golden Tigers in pursuit; the fierce beasts of the celestial apes; the guardians arrayed at the four gates—what is called arrives instantly, what is summoned appears before one. The vermilion script blazes forth, wind and fire unceasing. Wherever there is verification and subjugation, the golden dragon swiftly transmits. Conclude by knocking the teeth nine times, raising the head to the sky and emitting three whistles, drawing in the celestial qi three times, and pointing the Eight Mighty Staff’s script toward the designated place. Hold the breath for nine breaths and cease."*

**Method for Wielding the Divine Staff (12):**
When a Daoist wishes to employ the method of the divine staff, they should knock their teeth thirty-six times and visualize the *Direct Talisman Officials* of the Five Emperors, each clad in the color of their respective direction, their five-colored radiance flowing and illuminating the staff. Each of the Five Emperors’ Jade Maidens stands in attendance, guarding the staff to left and right. Silently intone:
*"Mountain of the Great Yang, primordial essence of the Highest Beginning, opener of heaven and extender of earth, sweet bamboo conduit of the numinous. Direct Talisman Guardians, officials who command the divine soldiers, five-colored radiance flowing upon the staff, crimson robes and golden bells—assist the perfected ones, emerging from darkness into obscurity. Summon the heavens, and the heavens obey; subjugate the earth, and the earth yields. Point at ghosts, and ghosts perish; bind demons, and malevolence takes form. The numinous talisman and divine staff command might over the hundred directions. With me they are accomplished, with me they are born. After ten thousand kalpas, they shall replace my form, their shadows becoming the Five Liberations. My spirit ascends to the Upper Clarity, receiving the talisman and proclaiming the mandate—none dare fail to heed with reverence."*
Conclude by drawing in the qi of the five directions twenty times. Point the staff toward the heavens, and the celestial deities will render homage; point it toward the earth, and the earthly spirits will receive and welcome. Point the staff toward the northeast, and the myriad ghosts will be bound in form.

**Purple-Script Method for Rescuing the Sun During an Eclipse (13):**
Purple-script oral formula: On the day of the eclipse, expose oneself in the central courtyard. Face the sun with a bright mirror, wield a large blade, and knock the teeth thirty-six times while facing south. Raise the head and intone:
*"Luminous Child of the Sun, essence of the radiant yang, Illuminating Perfected One of the Net, Jade Spirit within the shadow—through the cycles you ride the qi, ascending and descending in solemn clarity. The dark sphere plots within, encroaching upon the sun’s court. The Heavenly Mirror wields the staff; the Emperor’s ministers command the soldiers. The Three and Five hold their proper positions; the yang light shines through. Heaven and earth alternate in devouring—what presumptuous phantom dares arise? Return each to its place; let no deficiency or excess occur. The Jade Emperor proclaims the mandate—none dare fail to halt in reverence."*
Then draw in the qi twenty-four times and cease. Thus, heaven and earth return to their positions, the Three and Five shine in unison, the Luminous Child is moved to joy, the sun’s radiance returns, and the mysterious influx of flowing light descends upon one’s form. One’s name is inscribed upon the purple tablets, recorded in the jade chapters of the Upper Clarity. Within nine years, one shall ride the green chariot, soaring through the void, ascending to the Upper Clarity.

**Purple-Script Method for Rescuing the Moon During an Eclipse (14):**
Purple-script oral formula: On the day of the lunar eclipse, at dusk, expose oneself in the central courtyard. Take a jar of pure water, wield a blade, and face the moon while knocking the teeth sixteen times. Raise the head and intone:
*"Heaven and earth separate and unite; the round qi waxes and wanes. Encroaching upon the moon’s chamber, it offends the yellow radiance. The Emperor’s ministers wield their staves; the Jade Dawn mends the flaw. The heavenly soldiers array themselves; the divine lords unleash their might. What presumptuous phantom dares cling to the shadow and exploit the faint? Swiftly return to your original place; let no transgression occur."*
Repeat this invocation three times while facing the moon. With the blade, stir the water in the jar three times to the right, then cease. Face the water and draw in the qi sixteen times. The lunar eclipse will then dissolve, the celestial scene will be solemn and clear, the Three and Five will shine in unison, and the myriad palaces will be at peace. The True Person and Lady of Luminous Radiance within the moon, moved to joy and delight, will turn their mysterious radiance toward you. They shall record your name before the Northern Emperor, strike your name from the ledger of the dead, and inscribe it in the jade chapters of the Azure Palace. Twelve Jade Maidens shall be granted to attend and guard your form. After nine years of such practice, you shall ride the flying rosy clouds to ascend to the Moon’s Court. This method is most wondrous—do not practice it in the world. Those who obtain it must treasure and conceal it; be cautious never to transmit it lightly.

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Dispelling Filth and Impurities (Fifteen)**
Whenever a Daoist encounters a corpse, blood, or any impure substance, they should take a *zhū* of cinnabar, scatter it into water, and use it to wash their eyes, rinse their mouth, and cleanse their hands and feet. Upon completion, they shall enter their chamber, assume a proper resting posture, cross their hands over their heart, and knock their teeth together twice seven times. Then, bowing in the four directions, they shall recite the prayer:

*"The Three Primes and the Supreme Dao,
The Great One guards my form.
The Lord of Life and the Divine Youth,
The Five Spirits bring yellow peace.
Blood-corpses scatter and vanish,
Ominous filth sinks and decays.
The Seven Fluids coil and infuse,
The Five Viscera bloom anew.
Grant that I, a divine immortal,
Enjoy enduring prosperity and purity."*

After the prayer, close both eyes and hold the breath for a long while; a slight warmth within the body shall serve as the sign. Then knock the teeth together seven times and swallow saliva thrice. This is the Inner Method of the Three Primes for Dispelling Impurities.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Combing Hair and Washing the Head (Sixteen)**
Whenever a Daoist combs their hair to arrange their topknot or washes their head with unbound hair, they shall first knock their teeth together seven times, then recite the prayer:

*"The Supreme Emperor scatters blossoms,
The Mysterious Yin, great spirit.
On this auspicious day,
I comb my hair and wash away dust.
Banish evil, dispel misfortune,
Attain long life as a divine immortal."*

After reciting, arrange the topknot. Upon completion, knock the teeth together seven times again. This is called the Supreme Emperor’s Blossom-Scattering Inner Method for Combing Hair. Practicing it ensures freedom from illness throughout the year, sharp hearing and vision, and no pain in the head or brain.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Bathing the Body and Washing Hands and Face (Seventeen)**
Whenever a Daoist bathes their body or washes their hands and face, they shall first stand before the water and knock their teeth together three times, then recite the prayer:

*"The Four Great open and brighten,
Heaven and Earth endure as constants.
Mysterious waters cleanse impurity,
Banishing inauspicious omens.
The Twin Stars guard the gate,
The Seven Spirits settle the chambers.
Cloudy essences refine and bathe,
Myriad qi harmonize in health.
Within and without, prosperity and purity,
Preserve this yellow robe."*

After the prayer, knock the teeth together three more times, then wash the hands and face. This is called the Seven Chambers Prayer Method for Bathing Away Filth and Dispelling Misfortune. Those who practice it regularly shall attain divine clarity, vigorous blood, and repel all malign qi.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Praying Before Fasting and Eating (Eighteen)**
Whenever a Daoist enters seclusion for fasting, before eating, they shall hold their chopsticks in their left hand, knock the plate three times, and recite the prayer:

*"The Two Mysteries and the Supreme Dao,
The Four Poles are pure and cool.
The Supreme One, Lord of Emperors,
The Hundred Spirits bring yellow peace.
Receive sustenance in the Three Palaces,
Irrigate the numinous spleen.
Offer up the Supreme Harmony,
Feast on the five fragrant flavors.
The soul-embryo receives life,
The Seven Fluids flow and settle.
The hundred passages open in harmony,
The Five Viscera bloom with light.
The Twin Stars merge their radiance,
Soaring to ascend the Upper Clarity."*

After eating, knock the plate three more times. This is called the Way of the Soul-Embryo Receiving Fragrance and the Hundred Spirits Feasting on Sustenance. Practicing it regularly ensures divine clarity, harmonious qi, peaceful hun and po, dispels evil and trials, and perpetually preserves prosperity. The prayer is recited before eating.

When a Daoist faces a sumptuous feast, they shall compose their mind and focus on unity, visualizing the food before consuming it. After eating, they shall silently recite the prayer:

*"The hundred grains enter the stomach,
Uniting with the spirit in qi.
They replenish blood and fluids,
Causing corpse-demons to fall away.
Ascend in flight to the Golden Towers,
Abide long between Heaven and Earth.
Command the Six Dings,
Divine youths attend and guard."*

Those who practice this consistently shall cause malign qi to retreat and true qi to advance. The prayer is recited after eating.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Daoists’ Self-Massage of the Head and Face (Nineteen)**
To seek the Dao, one must first ensure clear eyes and sharp ears. The ears and eyes are the ladder for seeking the true and the gate for gathering the numinous; gain and loss are determined in an instant, and life and death are discerned by them. The great teachings are here revealed for practice:

Press the small hollows behind both eyebrows twenty-seven times. Then, with the palms and fingers, massage the area beneath the eyes and above the cheekbones. Next, rotate the ears thirty times, then stroke the forehead upward twenty-seven times, swallowing saliva as needed, without limit. Practicing this regularly sharpens hearing and vision. Perform it discreetly in private, and do not speak of its details.

Next, stroke the head in all four directions, smoothing the hair toward the topknot, repeating often. This disperses blood flow and prevents wind-dampness from congealing. Upon completion, press the four corners of the eyes eighteen times until one’s vision becomes clear and bright. This is the method for refining the spirit of the eyes. Practicing it regularly allows one to perceive the hundred spirits.

---

**The Supreme Yellow Plain Method for Seeking Responses Before Transmitting Teachings (Twenty)**
When transmitting the above methods, the master possessing the scriptures shall first seek a response before imparting them. They shall enter their chamber, burn incense, and secretly vow before the spirits. Then, bowing before the scriptures, they shall softly recite the prayer:

*"Supreme Primordial Sovereign,
Great Spirit of the Immortal Capital,
On this auspicious day,
I present eight vows.
Desiring to transmit the superior methods,
I dare to inform the numinous origin.
Whether it is permissible,
Await your response before proclaiming."*

After the prayer, retire to rest, and a numinous response shall surely be received. The disciple shall then know in their heart whether it is proper to transmit the teachings.

---

**The Jade Clarity Demon-Quelling Jade Emperor’s Prayer for Ghostly Defense and Numinous Protection (Twenty-One)**
The Jade Emperor’s prayer states:

*"The Nine Heavens issue the decree,
The Supreme Decree of Jade Clarity.
Hasten the summoning of the thousand perfected,
All to assemble in the imperial court.
The Great One gazes downward,
The Twin Sovereigns flank the form.
Scrutinizing the myriad evils,
Governing qi and preserving life.
If any inauspiciousness
Offends and tests the divine,
Invoke the Emperor’s Way,
Command the divine soldiers to prepare.
The Seven Spirits wield their axes,
The Celestial Blade marches to the right.
Brandish the sword to lead the vanguard,
Fling the fire-bells with radiance.
Issue the summons to the armored couriers,
The martial warriors and celestial Dings.
Wind and fire join the battle,
Vanquishing demons and subduing spirits.
Above, awe the Six Heavens,
Below, subdue the demonic numina.
Having awed and subdued them,
The myriad evils vanish in form.
The divine halberd sweeps like lightning,
No treacherous demons shall arise.
The Immortal Sovereigns hold the tally,
Dare any disobey the command?
Those who resist the tally and defy the decree
Shall be executed and destroyed.
Each be warned, each be vigilant,
Preserve this yellow peace.
The Nine Heavens proclaim the decree,
The myriad spirits heed with reverence."*

When a disciple travels at night and feels fear, their heart trembles and their will falters, or when plagued by nightmares, demonic forces test them, violating the true and disrupting qi to cause illness and harm, they shall swiftly perform the Jade Emperor’s Prayer for Ghostly Defense and Numinous Protection. The disciple shall focus their mind on the Supreme Dao, seeking aid from the Emperor. Facing north, they shall knock their teeth together thirty times, hold their breath, and secretly recite the prayer. Upon completion, knock the teeth again as before and swallow saliva ten times. Thus, treacherous evils shall be shattered, and demonic hordes subdued.

chunks.original_text: 七神缠绵，太一鉴摄，万灵卫真，外威凶气。 亦可日日讽习，振响唱诵，坐卧随意，以塞百邪之来试，闭奸鬼之凶迹。 当卧寝，亦常可诵之，令人神安意明，辟梦除厌，消诸毒恶，使终身不恐。 讽习之日，不复北向闭气也。 以闭气密祝者，谓鬼魔已试其左右，祆精已干其神室，故勑灵命真，以收其凶迹耳。 而寝卧之祝，不复同之於此法也。 玉清消魔道士叩齿节度法二十二 凡上清叩齿咽液之法，皆各有方，先后有次，不得乱杂，使真灵混错也。 夫叩齿以命神，咽气以和真，纳和咽六液，以运入制神，须鸣鼓而行列矣。 凡存修上法，礼祝之时，皆先啄齿，上下相叩，勿左右也，一呼一吸，令得咽诸气液耳。 此名为呼神和真，以求升仙者也。 其法叩齿，上下相叩名曰天鼓，左齿相叩名曰天钟，右齿相叩名曰天磬也，制鬼召魔，可叩钟磬，行道求真，叩天鼓也。 太上素灵道士闻耳鸣祝法二十三 闻耳鸣者，错手掩耳，而祝曰： 赤子在宫，九真在房，诸神听命，亦察不祥，太一流火，以灭万凶。 毕，以手掩耳门一七过，当闻面热即佳候也，若闻头颈间色色寒者，恶气入也，当急卧临目，存玄丹宫太一真君，以流火之铃焕而掷之，令恶气即出耳外，火光亦随之在后，炯炯然以照一身，良久平复也。 太上素灵审察耳鸣吉凶法二十四 耳中忽闻濑水声，雷霆及鼓鸣者，是体中劳损，心藏极弊，不能味真注生，而淫放丧乱，使六府失摄，魂魄哀号，盖将结疾致死亡之兆矣。 是以泥丸纵法，九宫失常，悲扰翻错，鸣鼓乱行，将欲舍其居绾以弃一身也。 闻之者当精念大一真君反迷还专真心，若罪未深者，自听改也，所以耳聋者，耳神亡之故也。 耳中忽闻金声玉音者，真气来入，道欲成也。 忽闻弦乐之声者，六丁玉女来卫子道也。 当隐静专修所行，勤至之心愈弥於往也，真人因是遂有形见之渐矣。 自非尔师，且勿言於他人也。 耳中闻箫角之音，吉象贵至也。 闻叫唤号呼之声者，凶象贱至也。 闻臭气者，必有殗秽之事，急更衣沐浴烧香，扫除寝宇以答之，此是帝君将戒劝於人者也。 若闻血气者，及无故见聚血者，兵凶也。 急遁人间，守三元帝君，求救自藏，斋三月，祸亦止也。 此皆帝君先告人吉凶，以令惧诚其祸福耳。 夫见凶象，当行阴德，营於惠救，为人所不能为，行人所不能行者，始免乎必死之候也。 子其勖之，勿守常而已。 金真玉光施安斋堂五方符法二十五

The Seven Spirits entwine in harmony,
The Great One surveys and governs,
Myriad numina guard the true,
Repelling malevolent qi from without.

This may also be chanted daily, resonantly recited,
Whether sitting or reclining at will,
To block the approach of all demonic trials,
Sealing the ominous traces of treacherous ghosts.
When retiring to rest, one may also recite it often,
To calm the spirit and clarify the mind,
Dispel nightmares and banish afflictions,
Dissolve all poisons and evils,
Ensuring lifelong freedom from fear.

On days of recitation, one need not face north or hold the breath.
The method of holding the breath and secret prayer
Is used when demonic forces have already tested one’s surroundings,
When pernicious essences have invaded the chamber of the spirit,
Thus commanding the numinous and summoning the true
To gather and suppress their ominous traces.
Yet the prayer for rest and repose
Differs from this method.

**Jade Clarity Demon-Dispelling Daoist Teeth-Knocking Ritual Protocol (22)**
All Highest Clarity methods of knocking teeth and swallowing saliva
Follow specific directions, with a proper sequence before and after,
Lest the true spirits become confused and disordered.
Knocking teeth summons the spirits,
Swallowing qi harmonizes the true.
Drawing in harmony and swallowing the Six Fluids
Directs and restrains the spirits,
Requiring the drum’s resonance to proceed in order.

In all practices of the above methods,
During rituals and prayers,
First tap the teeth,
Upper and lower knocking together,
Not side to side,
With each inhalation and exhalation,
To enable the swallowing of all qi and fluids.
This is called "summoning the spirits and harmonizing the true,"
A practice for those seeking ascension as immortals.

The method of knocking teeth:
Upper and lower knocking together is called the "Heavenly Drum,"
Left teeth knocking together is called the "Heavenly Bell,"
Right teeth knocking together is called the "Heavenly Chime."
To subdue ghosts and summon demons, knock the bell and chime;
To practice the Dao and seek the true, knock the Heavenly Drum.

**Supreme Simplicity Numinous Daoist Prayer for Ringing Ears (23)**
Upon hearing ringing in the ears,
Cross the hands to cover the ears and pray:
*"The Red Child dwells in the palace,
The Nine True Ones reside in the chamber.
All spirits, heed the command,
Examine and avert misfortune.
The Great One flows fire
To extinguish the ten thousand evils."*

Afterward, cover the ear gates twenty-one times.
When warmth is felt in the face, it is an auspicious sign.
If cold sensations arise in the head or neck,
It signals the entry of malevolent qi.
One should swiftly lie down, close the eyes,
And visualize the True Lord of the Great One in the Cinnabar Palace,
Wielding a flowing-fire bell to cast it forth,
Driving the malevolent qi out of the ears,
With firelight following behind,
Brightly illuminating the entire body.
After a long while, peace will be restored.

**Supreme Simplicity Numinous Method for Discerning Auspicious and Ominous Ear Ringing (24)**
If one suddenly hears the sound of rushing water,
Thunder, or drumming in the ears,
It signifies bodily exhaustion,
The heart’s storehouse severely damaged,
Unable to savor the true or sustain life,
Indulging in dissipation and disorder,
Causing the Six Palaces to lose control,
The hun and po to wail in sorrow—
A portent of impending illness and death.

Thus, the Muddy Pellet’s governance falters,
The Nine Palaces lose their regularity,
Sorrow and disturbance overturn order,
Drumming sounds chaotically,
As if abandoning their abode to forsake the body.
Upon hearing this, one should concentrate the mind
On the Great One True Lord,
To reverse delusion and restore the true heart.
If the transgression is not grave,
The condition may naturally improve.
Deafness occurs because the ear spirit has departed.

If one suddenly hears the sound of gold or jade tones,
It signifies the arrival of true qi,
And the Dao is nearing fruition.
If one hears the sound of stringed or wind instruments,
The Six Ding Jade Maidens have come to guard your Dao.
One should retreat into seclusion,
Devoting oneself to cultivation with greater diligence than before.
Thus, the Perfected One will gradually manifest in form.
Yet unless they are your master,
Do not speak of this to others.

Hearing the sound of flutes or horns
Is an auspicious omen heralding nobility.
Hearing cries, shouts, or wails
Is an ominous sign foretelling misfortune.
If one smells a foul odor,
There will surely be unclean matters.
Hastily change clothes, bathe, burn incense,
And sweep the bedchamber to respond,
For this is the Celestial Lord’s warning to the practitioner.

If one smells blood or qi,
Or unexpectedly sees a gathering of blood,
It portends military strife.
Swiftly retreat from the mortal realm,
Seek refuge with the Three Origin Lords,
Pray for deliverance and conceal yourself,
Observe a fast for three months,
And the calamity will cease.
These are all the Celestial Lord’s advance warnings of fortune and misfortune,
To inspire awe and caution regarding blessings and disasters.

Upon witnessing ominous signs,
One should practice hidden virtue,
Engage in acts of kindness and rescue,
Do what others cannot,
And undertake what others will not,
Only then may one escape the certainty of death.
Strive diligently, and do not remain complacent.
